author: lena.kemna
title: Understanding the Cardano community
description: To grow the Cardano network, we first have to deeply understand it: How do people use it? What do they value? How could it be more communal?

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal raises an important goal – that understanding the community of end-users is a critical first step to developing technology. However, the proposer seems new to the Cardano community (just a guess) and therefore unaware of many of the existing initiatives in this area.  Because IOG is not rolling out Atala PRISM as a top-down initiative, but rather empowering individuals to create solutions that best fit their own communities and needs, many proposers are creating and developing Atala PRISM solutions that are tailor-made to the communities that they inhabit and know best. While a broad survey of the Cardano community could be extremely valuable, I am not sure it is essential to the process of developing Atala PRISM solutions.  Furthermore, it is not clear to me who would benefit from the findings. Would developers who had not previously planned to build DID applications come up with new ideas based on the results of this survey?
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does not give a lot of detail about her background or experience. From googling I was able to take a guess at her LinkedIn profile. I would be interested to see more details about what it would mean to conduct an ethnographic study. I would also be curious as to how the proposer plans to reach respondents, and motivate them to respond. It would be interesting to see metrics around how many responses she is targeting or anticipating, and why that number would be meaningful and representative. There is also no distribution plan for providing the results of the survey to anyone who might be impacted by them. Currently IOG does a survey at the end of every Fund, and the AIM team was recently funded to run an incentivized survey of Fund6 voters. It would be helpful if the proposal referenced these already existing surveys in order to have a plan to perhaps coordinate surveying activity to maximize the likelihood of participation by targeted respondents.
f6_assessments.q2: While the budget amount is not large, there are no metrics supporting the request for 1,000 per month. I can't envision what the milestone would be at the end of the first month so that it would be clear that work had been performed. It would be helpful if the proposal provided more detail and more deliverables. For example, a bibliography detailing the literature review could be provided at the end of the first month. It also isn't clear how the 1000 would be distributed to research participants.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem and the solution to the problem are presented in a vague manner. What is the meaning of words "more communal"? - will be a question that an outsider will ask first. It is about "to describe something that is shared by a group of people"? If so, it's an adjective that has no comparison grades as something public can't be more than what it is already. If it has other meaning it will be wise to make the statement more clear than what it is now. "Implementation suggestions" has no meaning as well for an outsider who reads the proposal.

It is unclear how an ethnographic study can be performed for the Cardano Network as this is more like a generic name for an ecosystem. And why the impact of such study will matter to the audience?

Reading the proposal makes it difficult to understand the direction is heading on.
f6_assessments.q1:
There are no trails/evidences to support the proposer's expertize (links to social media, to projects in which you were involved etc.).

It is not clear what "literature research" means (what is the value added using systematic review for an already peer reviewed research? what is the magnitude (quantity) of such activity?)

The proposer should first define the area of  the research. If she thinks globally when she researches "community", this kind of activity requires an enormous amount of resources to be spent to have an accepted outcome.

There is no clear explanation why Atala Prism could be a beneficiary of this activity.  (it depends a lot on governments' vision to use DID and has less to do with the cultural aspects of any country)

The proposal doesn't provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows what is being done and how.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal reads poorly and is very difficult for an outsider to understand the meaning of this project.

No KPIs/metrics are defined to measure the success of this project (how many deliverables will be available and in what form? How do you measure the impact of these materials - questionnaire, surveys?)

The proposal needs more editing so that it can be assessed properly given its direction. Perhaps reworking it and submitting it at the later stages will work better.

f6_assessments.q0:
Without willing to change the title of this proposal, but for me it would be more clear if the proposer suggest as title: ''Understanding the digital credentials within the Cardano community''
This will clearly demonstrates right from the beginning the focus of the research to be conducted.
f6_assessments.q1:
Lay out documents resulting from research about the Atala Prism, the Cardano ecosystem,  ethnographic study of the Cardano network.. would be beneficial to the community, and will allow members to deepener their  understanding of the ecosystem.
This proposal may be a first step of a study to be conducted around the interoperability within the Cardano ecosystem.
The operational plan is clear and the timeframe defined, including the budget.
The objective of the research is not yet clearly well defined from my opinion, but the need of research is there.
f6_assessments.q2:
No element of progress evaluation has been suggested by the Proposer in the current version of the proposal. It would be essential to add it, even if the final result would be known as it'll be published for consulted by community members.
Risks haven't been mentioned

f6_assessments.q0: I think this proposal is quite vague and does not provide a practical solution to solve the problem that the group has posed. I think the team should review the summary in more detail and specificity. Consider clarifying how you can increase the ecosystem. I suggest you come up with detailed solutions.
f6_assessments.q1:
I have the following additions:
if you don't mind, change the problem statement to something that seems obvious, tangible, and interested people who most likely want quick results. also, it would be better if you mention the timelines.
I think the recommendation would be a lot better if the team mentioned in there that you would do the research to find the best fit for both cardano and atala prisms to achieve wider adoption. along with The team also needs to be able to come up with documentation as well as anything to back up the team's claims of experience.
f6_assessments.q2: the proposal team has not come up with any reliable information to prove the proposal can be successful. i have a question whether by providing 7000usd capital to you we will be able to track the progress where? Not to mention with a rather sketchy project without any convincing information, sorry to say that this is a rather poor proposal. I hope you can learn from experience and come up with a full project version. enough information about the budget, specific roadmap and proven examples as well as transparency about team members, so that it can be appreciated by the community next time.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea of researching to understand users in Cardano community is useful and can help a lot to projects that are developing in Cardano ecosystem. 
Unfortunately, the team doesn't add any key metrics into the proposal to show that they're really concerned about what the challenge address. My recommendation for this idea should be: research document about users, number of project will use it, total view to the finished documents... and some others that the team want.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no implementation plan and detailed explanations about what they will do to get what they want that mentioned in the proposal. For the idea, this team suggested, my advice is that they should have detail about the flow of research, categories that they will set, target audiences... 
After that, they should make a more detailed roadmap instead of a timeline with titles only. And some relevant risks, that the team don't mention here. 
At last, the budget that the team required is suitable with the provided roadmap and I think it is close enough for one person focus to finish it.
f6_assessments.q2:
They have a short roadmap but lack key metrics, so we cannot track and audit this project. 
The team has a detailed explanation about the solution that they will go, but lacks observation about the problem that they mention in the first place.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about: (1) systematic literature review of peer-reviewed research; (2) an ethnographic study of the Cardano network; (3) Implementation suggestions.
This is a great idea, since research-based improvement is a unique characteristic of Cardano Blockchain. The solution is clearly defined, with a convincing timeline for conducting an academic study. I can see the potential impact on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole in long term with this academic work. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly agree with this proposal's impact, I would rate it with a score of 5
f6_assessments.q1: Described as Ph.D. in Management candidate focusing on community (purpose, co-creation, identity) with previous community research on feminists in Jakarta, I agree that that is suitable to this academic study, however, since there is no profile provided, I can not know for sure. In another word, proof of feasibility from the proposer experience is still unclear. The budget is unclear, without explanation [why "1000/month"? or why "1000 to give to research participants" ?]. Risk is not defined [or there is no risk foreseen]. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, I would rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provided a lot of meaningful information. However, for better auditability, the following information should be added: (1) the proposer's profile with external links for verification; (2) budget explanation for each item; (3) risk management analysis. Therefore, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's auditability, I would rate it with a score of 2

experience:
PhD in Management candidate focusing on community (purpose, co-creation, identity).
Previous community research on feminists in Jakarta.
